articles.headline: A Fading Coal County Bets on Schools, but There’s One Big Hitch
articles.snippet: Hard hit by the decline of mining, a rural area in West Virginia is trying to attract teachers in a comeback effort. What’s lacking are jobs for the graduates.
articles.abstract: Hard hit by the decline of mining, a rural area in West Virginia is trying to attract teachers in a comeback effort. What’s lacking are jobs for the graduates.
articles.lead_paragraph: WELCH, W.Va. — Lillian Keys came back.

articles.headline: Judges Halt Race and Gender Priority for Restaurant Relief Grants
articles.snippet: Approvals for thousands of Restaurant Revitalization Fund applicants were rescinded after court orders struck down a policy that favored historically underserved groups.
articles.abstract: Approvals for thousands of Restaurant Revitalization Fund applicants were rescinded after court orders struck down a policy that favored historically underserved groups.
articles.lead_paragraph: Lawsuits brought by white business owners challenging a policy that prioritized applicants for pandemic relief grants on the basis of gender and race have thrown the federal government’s Restaurant Revitalization Fund into turmoil.

articles.headline: What Data About You Can the Government Get From Big Tech?
articles.snippet: The revelations of a leak investigation started in the Trump administration are a reminder that Big Tech companies often hand over information about their users.
articles.abstract: The revelations of a leak investigation started in the Trump administration are a reminder that Big Tech companies often hand over information about their users.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Justice Department, starting in the early days of the Trump administration, secretly sought data from some of the biggest tech companies about journalists, Democratic lawmakers and White House officials as part of wide-ranging investigations into leaks and other matters, The New York Times reported last week.

articles.headline: Shifting Focus, NATO Views China as a Global Security Challenge
articles.snippet: NATO leaders expressed a new concern about China’s growing military might, signaling a fundamental shift in the attentions of an alliance devoted to protecting Europe and North America — not Asia.
articles.abstract: NATO leaders expressed a new concern about China’s growing military might, signaling a fundamental shift in the attentions of an alliance devoted to protecting Europe and North America — not Asia.
articles.lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS — China’s rising military ambitions are presenting NATO with challenges that must be addressed, the 30-nation Western alliance said Monday, the first time it has portrayed the expanding reach and capabilities of the Chinese armed forces in such a potentially confrontational way.
articles.byline: By Steven Erlanger and Michael D. Shear

articles.headline: Shift in Israel Provides Biden a Chance for Better Ties
articles.snippet: The departure of Benjamin Netanyahu as prime minister is a relief for Democrats, but Iran and the Palestinians could test Mr. Biden’s relations with a fragile new Israeli government.
articles.abstract: The departure of Benjamin Netanyahu as prime minister is a relief for Democrats, but Iran and the Palestinians could test Mr. Biden’s relations with a fragile new Israeli government.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Biden waited more than three weeks after his inauguration to place his first call to Benjamin Netanyahu, Israel’s prime minister at the time. It took Mr. Biden less than three hours after the swearing in on Sunday of Mr. Netanyahu’s successor, Naftali Bennett, to phone with what the White House called his “warm congratulations.”

articles.headline: Stephen Colbert Returns to ‘Late Show’ Stage Before Vaccinated Fans
articles.snippet: In a sign of life going back to normal, a capacity crowd at the Ed Sullivan Theater — face masks optional — roared for the highest-rated late night host.
articles.abstract: In a sign of life going back to normal, a capacity crowd at the Ed Sullivan Theater — face masks optional — roared for the highest-rated late night host.
articles.lead_paragraph: There was a hug for the bandleader, Jon Batiste, without any need for social distancing. There were chants of “Ste-phen! Ste-phen! Ste-phen!” And a standing ovation that lasted a minute and a half.

articles.headline: Trump Pressed Official to Wield Justice Dept. to Back Election Claims
articles.snippet: The former president began pressuring his incoming acting attorney general even before announcing that his predecessor was stepping down, emails show.
articles.abstract: The former president began pressuring his incoming acting attorney general even before announcing that his predecessor was stepping down, emails show.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — An hour before President Donald J. Trump announced in December that William P. Barr would step down as attorney general, the president began pressuring Mr. Barr’s eventual replacement to have the Justice Department take up his false claims of election fraud.

articles.headline: U.S. and E.U. End Aviation Trade Spat and Turn to China’s Rise
articles.snippet: The agreement, coming as President Biden met European leaders, ends a 17-year dispute over aircraft subsidies.
articles.abstract: The agreement, coming as President Biden met European leaders, ends a 17-year dispute over aircraft subsidies.
articles.lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS — The United States and Europe on Tuesday agreed to put aside a 17-year dispute over aircraft subsidies for Boeing and Airbus and work together to counter China’s global ambitions to dominate key industries.
articles.byline: By Steven Erlanger and Michael D. Shear

articles.headline: MacKenzie Scott Gives Away Another $2.74 Billion Even as Her Wealth Grows
articles.snippet: Ms. Scott made a new round of grants, to 286 organizations. Her net worth, which Forbes estimates at $60 billion, keeps rising, thanks to Amazon stock.
articles.abstract: Ms. Scott made a new round of grants, to 286 organizations. Her net worth, which Forbes estimates at $60 billion, keeps rising, thanks to Amazon stock.
articles.lead_paragraph: MacKenzie Scott promised she would give her fortune away “until the safe is empty.” That has proved to be harder than expected.
articles.byline: By Nicholas Kulish and David Gelles
